sources.title: The Frozen North
sources.description: IMDB.com: This satirical parody of William S. Hart's melodramatic films finds Buster in the frozen north

sources.title: Buster Keaton's "The Frozen North" (1922)
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems   "The Frozen North" is a short comedy, starring Buster Keaton and featuring Joe Roberts, a star of Silent Hall of Fame.  Directed by               Eddie Cline, Buster Keaton Produced by             Joseph Schenck Scenario by               Eddie Cline, Buster Keaton           Starring                     Buster Keaton, Joe Roberts Cinematography        Elgin Lessley Distributed by           First National Pictures Inc. Release date               August 28, 1922 Running time             17 min. Country                      United States Language                    Silent film, English intertitles Copyright Disclaimer Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976: "Allowance is made for "fair use" for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research. Fair use is a use permitted by copyright statute that might otherwise be infringing. Non-profit, educational or personal use tips the balance in favor of fair use."

sources.title: The Frozen North
sources.description: William S. Hart's melodramatic film finds Buster in the frozen north, "last stop on the subway." He uses a wanted poster as his partner in robbing a gambling house. When he thinks he spies his wife making love to another man he shoots them both only to learn it isn't his cabin after all.

metadata.Plot: This satirical parody of William S. Hart's melodramatic films finds Buster in the frozen north, "last stop on the subway." He uses a wanted poster as his partner in robbing a gambling house. When he thinks he spies his wife making love to another man he shoots them both only to learn it isn't his cabin after all.
metadata.Actors: Buster Keaton, Edward F. Cline, Marion Harlan
